dt.t: annexation of the suburban fringe by the {wi}nuclear{/wi} metropolis

dt: {bc}of or relating to the atomic nucleus
{bc}used in or produced by a nuclear reaction (such as fission)
{bc}being a weapon whose destructive power derives from an uncontrolled nuclear reaction
{bc}of, produced by, or involving nuclear weapons
{bc}of, relating to, or powered by nuclear energy
{bc}to become wildly excited or upset {bc}to go berserk

dt.t: To say the crowd went wild is an understatement. The crowd {wi}went nuclear{/wi}. Outside the stadium, cars were overturned and fires were set. We sportswriters huddled inside, fearing for our lives.

pt: Though disapproved of by many, pronunciations ending in \-kyə-lər\ have been found in widespread use among educated speakers including scientists, lawyers, professors, congressmen, U.S. cabinet members, and at least two U.S. presidents and one vice president. While most common in the U.S., these pronunciations have also been heard from British and Canadian speakers.

shortdef: of, relating to, or constituting a nucleus
of or relating to the atomic nucleus
used in or produced by a nuclear reaction (such as fission)

dt: {bc}a family group that consists only of parents and children

shortdef: a family group that consists only of parents and children

dt: {bc}the magnetic resonance of an atomic nucleus
{bc}chemical analysis that uses such resonance especially to study molecular structure

shortdef: the magnetic resonance of an atomic nucleus; also : chemical analysis that uses such resonance especially to study molecular structure

dt: {bc}a branch of medicine dealing with the use of radioactive materials in the diagnosis and treatment of disease

shortdef: a branch of medicine dealing with the use of radioactive materials in the diagnosis and treatment of disease

dt: {bc}a double membrane enclosing a cell nucleus and having its outer part continuous with the endoplasmic reticulum

shortdef: a double membrane enclosing a cell nucleus and having its outer part continuous with the endoplasmic reticulum —called also nuclear envelope

dt: {bc}the option of using nuclear weapons in war

dt.t: … it is now unimaginable that we would use anything approaching the full measure of our military power (the {wi}nuclear option{/wi} aside) in the wars we fight.

dt: {bc}an extreme option regarded as a drastic step or last resort

dt.t: The EU has most leverage over countries that are desperate to join. Once in the club, with full voting rights, countries can answer back, leaving their peers with only the {wi}nuclear option{/wi} of trying to expel them.

dt: {bc}a parliamentary procedure in the U.S. Senate by which the requirement of the affirmative votes of a {d_link|supermajority|supermajority} of senators is changed to require only a simple majority to invoke {d_link|cloture|cloture:1} in order to stop a filibuster and allow a vote on a matter (such as a judicial nomination) to proceed

dt.t: Since Republicans can't muster the 60 votes necessary to overcome this particular filibuster, they now want to use their authority over Senate procedures to abolish the maneuver itself, at least for judicial nominees. Exercising this "{wi}nuclear option{/wi}," as it is known, would theoretically require the support of just a simple majority of senators, which Republican leaders say they are on the verge of solidifying.

shortdef: the option of using nuclear weapons in war

an extreme option regarded as a drastic step or last resort; specifically, US politics : a parliamentary procedure in the U.S. Senate by which the requirement of the affirmative votes of a supermajority of senators is changed to require only a simple majority to invoke cloture in order to stop a filibuster and allow a vote on a matter (such as a judicial nomination) to proceed

dt: {bc}the clear homogeneous ground substance of a cell nucleus

shortdef: the clear homogeneous ground substance of a cell nucleus

dt: {bc}the chilling of climate that is hypothesized to be a consequence of nuclear war and to result from the prolonged blockage of sunlight by high-altitude dust clouds produced by nuclear explosions

shortdef: the chilling of climate that is hypothesized to be a consequence of nuclear war and to result from the prolonged blockage of sunlight by high-altitude dust clouds produced by nuclear explosions

dt.t: The country does not have {it}nuclear capability{/it}.

dt: {bc}energy that is created by splitting apart the nuclei of atoms

shortdef: energy that is created by splitting apart the nuclei of atoms
